intro: Trichodesma khasianum, commonly known as the Khasi trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. It has trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
